meanings.definition: Inclined to engage in lawsuits or legal disputes.
meanings.sent1: The litigious neighbor always found reasons to sue others over small matters.
meanings.sent2: The company faced a litigious situation when a customer claimed injury on their premises.
meanings.sent3: The litigious cat kept taking the other pets to 'court' for stealing its toys.
meanings.sent4: Her litigious nature turned every disagreement into a legal battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The litigious storm of lawsuits left the town in chaos.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to litigation or legal action.
meanings.sent1: The litigious process of resolving the dispute took months in court.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer specialized in handling litigious matters for large corporations.
meanings.sent3: The litigious paperwork seemed to multiply on the desk overnight.
meanings.sent4: His litigious approach to negotiations made reaching agreements difficult.
meanings.sent5: The litigious atmosphere in the courtroom was tense and full of legal jargon.
